<task>
Perform a comprehensive audit of the project to ensure all referenced resources are present and the project is ready for release.

1.  **Analyze Scripts**: Scan all scripts in `scripts/` and `setup.sh` to identify every file they attempt to copy or reference from the `assets/` directory.
2.  **Verify Assets**: Check if all identified assets actually exist in the `assets/` directory. Pay special attention to:
    *   Fonts (check if all fonts mentioned in `core_setup.sh` are present).
    *   Config files (starship, atuin, kitty, tmux, etc.).
    *   Images (e.g., `assets/images/jedi.png`, `assets/packettracer.png`).
    *   Desktop entries (`assets/cisco-pt.desktop`).
    *   VS Code settings and extensions list.
    *   Godot settings.
3.  **Check for Missing Installers**: Verify if `scripts/packettracer_setup.sh` expects a `.deb` file and if it's present or if the script handles its absence gracefully (it should skip if missing, but we should verify the logic).
4.  **Report Findings**:
    *   List any missing files.
    *   List any inconsistencies between the scripts and the assets.
    *   Confirm if the `README.md` accurately reflects the current state of the project (e.g., flags, features).

Use `attempt_completion` to report the audit results.
</task>

<files>
<file><path>scripts/core_setup.sh</path>
<content lines="1-198">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | # =============================================================================
  3 | # core_setup.sh - Core system setup: packages, shell, fonts, dotfiles
  4 | # =============================================================================
  5 | 
  6 | set -e
  7 | 
  8 | # Source common utilities
  9 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
 10 | source "$SCRIPT_DIR/common.sh"
 11 | 
 12 | check_not_root
 13 | verify_backup_dir
 14 | 
 15 | # =============================================================================
 16 | # System Update
 17 | # =============================================================================
 18 | log_section "Updating system..."
 19 | sudo dnf update -y
 20 | log_success "System updated"
 21 | 
 22 | # =============================================================================
 23 | # Install Core Packages
 24 | # =============================================================================
 25 | log_section "Installing core packages..."
 26 | 
 27 | CORE_PACKAGES=(
 28 |     zsh
 29 |     git
 30 |     curl
 31 |     wget
 32 |     util-linux-user
 33 |     fastfetch
 34 |     kitty
 35 |     podman
 36 |     podman-compose
 37 |     tmux
 38 | )
 39 | 
 40 | dnf_install "${CORE_PACKAGES[@]}"
 41 | log_success "Core packages installed"
 42 | 
 43 | # =============================================================================
 44 | # Install Starship
 45 | # =============================================================================
 46 | log_section "Installing Starship..."
 47 | if dnf_install starship 2>/dev/null; then
 48 |     log_success "Starship installed via dnf"
 49 | else
 50 |     log_warn "Starship not in repos, installing via official script..."
 51 |     curl -sS https://starship.rs/install.sh | sh -s -- -y
 52 |     log_success "Starship installed via official script"
 53 | fi
 54 | 
 55 | # =============================================================================
 56 | # Install Atuin
 57 | # =============================================================================
 58 | log_section "Installing Atuin..."
 59 | if dnf_install atuin 2>/dev/null; then
 60 |     log_success "Atuin installed via dnf"
 61 | else
 62 |     log_warn "Atuin not in repos, installing via official script..."
 63 |     curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://setup.atuin.sh | bash
 64 |     log_success "Atuin installed via official script"
 65 | fi
 66 | 
 67 | # =============================================================================
 68 | # Install Zsh Plugins
 69 | # =============================================================================
 70 | log_section "Installing Zsh plugins..."
 71 | dnf_install zsh-autosuggestions zsh-syntax-highlighting
 72 | log_success "zsh-autosuggestions and zsh-syntax-highlighting installed"
 73 | 
 74 | # zsh-autocomplete
 75 | ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM="/usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh"
 76 | ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL="$HOME/.local/share/zsh/plugins/zsh-autocomplete"
 77 | 
 78 | if dnf_install zsh-autocomplete 2>/dev/null && [[ -f "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM" ]]; then
 79 |     log_success "zsh-autocomplete installed via dnf"
 80 | else
 81 |     log_warn "zsh-autocomplete not in repos, cloning from GitHub..."
 82 |     ensure_dir "$HOME/.local/share/zsh/plugins"
 83 |     rm -rf "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL" 2>/dev/null || true
 84 |     git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/marlonrichert/zsh-autocomplete.git "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
 85 |     log_success "zsh-autocomplete cloned to $ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
 86 | fi
 87 | 
 88 | # =============================================================================
 89 | # Restore Dotfiles
 90 | # =============================================================================
 91 | log_section "Restoring dotfiles..."
 92 | 
 93 | # .zshrc
 94 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.zshrc" ]]; then
 95 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.zshrc" ~/
 96 |     # Update zsh-autocomplete path if using local installation
 97 |     if [[ ! -f "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM" ]] && [[ -d "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL" ]]; then
 98 |         sed -i "s|source /usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh|source $ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh|g" ~/.zshrc
 99 |         log_success ".zshrc copied and updated with local zsh-autocomplete path"
100 |     else
101 |         log_success ".zshrc copied"
102 |     fi
103 | fi
104 | 
105 | # .bashrc
106 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.bashrc" ]]; then
107 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.bashrc" ~/
108 |     log_success ".bashrc copied"
109 | fi
110 | 
111 | # .gitconfig
112 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.gitconfig" ]]; then
113 |     if [[ -f ~/.gitconfig ]]; then
114 |         cp ~/.gitconfig ~/.gitconfig.backup
115 |         log_warn "Existing .gitconfig backed up"
116 |     fi
117 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.gitconfig" ~/
118 |     log_success ".gitconfig copied"
119 | fi
120 | 
121 | # =============================================================================
122 | # Restore .config directories
123 | # =============================================================================
124 | log_section "Restoring .config directories..."
125 | ensure_dir ~/.config
126 | 
127 | # starship.toml
128 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship/starship.toml" ]]; then
129 |     ensure_dir ~/.config/starship
130 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship/starship.toml" ~/.config/starship/
131 |     log_success "starship.toml copied"
132 | elif [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship.toml" ]]; then
133 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship.toml" ~/.config/
134 |     log_success "starship.toml copied"
135 | fi
136 | 
137 | # atuin config
138 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/atuin" ]]; then
139 |     copy_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/atuin" ~/.config/atuin
140 | fi
141 | 
142 | # fastfetch config
143 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fastfetch" ]]; then
144 |     copy_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fastfetch" ~/.config/fastfetch
145 | fi
146 | 
147 | # fastfetch custom logo
148 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/images/jedi.png" ]]; then
149 |     ensure_dir ~/.config/fastfetch/assets
150 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/images/jedi.png" ~/.config/fastfetch/assets/
151 |     log_success "fastfetch custom logo (jedi.png) copied"
152 | fi
153 | 
154 | # fish config
155 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fish" ]]; then
156 |     copy_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fish" ~/.config/fish
157 | fi
158 | 
159 | # kitty config
160 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/kitty" ]]; then
161 |     copy_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/kitty" ~/.config/kitty
162 | fi
163 | 
164 | # tmux config
165 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/tmux" ]]; then
166 |     copy_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/tmux" ~/.config/tmux
167 | elif [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.tmux.conf" ]]; then
168 |     ensure_dir ~/.config/tmux
169 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.tmux.conf" ~/.config/tmux/tmux.conf
170 |     log_success "tmux.conf copied to ~/.config/tmux/"
171 | fi
172 | 
173 | # =============================================================================
174 | # Install Fonts
175 | # =============================================================================
176 | log_section "Installing fonts..."
177 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/fonts" ]]; then
178 |     ensure_dir ~/.local/share/fonts
179 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/fonts/"*.ttf ~/.local/share/fonts/ 2>/dev/null || true
180 |     fc-cache -fv
181 |     log_success "Fonts installed and cache updated"
182 | else
183 |     log_warn "No fonts directory found in backup"
184 | fi
185 | 
186 | # =============================================================================
187 | # Change Default Shell to Zsh
188 | # =============================================================================
189 | log_section "Setting default shell to Zsh..."
190 | ZSH_PATH="$(which zsh)"
191 | if [[ "$SHELL" != "$ZSH_PATH" ]]; then
192 |     chsh -s "$ZSH_PATH"
193 |     log_success "Default shell changed to zsh (takes effect on next login)"
194 | else
195 |     log_success "Zsh is already the default shell"
196 | fi
197 | 
198 | log_section "Core setup complete!"
</content>
</file>

<content lines="1-204">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | # =============================================================================
  3 | # enhance_terminal.sh - Install power tools for enhanced terminal experience
  4 | # =============================================================================
  5 | 
  6 | set -e
  7 | 
  8 | # Source common utilities
  9 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
 10 | source "$SCRIPT_DIR/common.sh"
 11 | 
 12 | check_not_root
 13 | verify_backup_dir
 14 | 
 15 | # =============================================================================
 16 | # Install Power Tools via DNF
 17 | # =============================================================================
 18 | log_section "Installing Power Tools..."
 19 | 
 20 | # Tools available in Fedora repos
 21 | POWER_TOOLS=(
 22 |     zoxide      # Smart cd replacement
 23 |     eza         # Modern ls replacement
 24 |     bat         # Cat with syntax highlighting
 25 |     fzf         # Fuzzy finder
 26 |     ripgrep     # Fast grep alternative (useful with fzf)
 27 |     fd-find     # Fast find alternative (useful with fzf)
 28 | )
 29 | 
 30 | log_info "Installing tools from DNF repositories..."
 31 | dnf_install "${POWER_TOOLS[@]}"
 32 | log_success "DNF tools installed"
 33 | 
 34 | # =============================================================================
 35 | # Install Lazygit
 36 | # =============================================================================
 37 | log_section "Installing Lazygit..."
 38 | 
 39 | if check_command lazygit; then
 40 |     log_success "Lazygit already installed"
 41 | else
 42 |     # Add Lazygit COPR repository
 43 |     if ! sudo dnf copr list | grep -q "atim/lazygit"; then
 44 |         log_info "Adding Lazygit COPR repository..."
 45 |         sudo dnf copr enable atim/lazygit -y
 46 |     fi
 47 |     dnf_install lazygit
 48 |     log_success "Lazygit installed"
 49 | fi
 50 | 
 51 | # =============================================================================
 52 | # Install Yazi (Terminal File Manager)
 53 | # =============================================================================
 54 | log_section "Installing Yazi..."
 55 | 
 56 | if check_command yazi; then
 57 |     log_success "Yazi already installed"
 58 | else
 59 |     # Yazi is available via cargo or prebuilt binaries
 60 |     # Using prebuilt binary for faster installation
 61 |     YAZI_VERSION="0.4.2"
 62 |     YAZI_URL="https://github.com/sxyazi/yazi/releases/download/v${YAZI_VERSION}/yazi-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu.zip"
 63 |     TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)
 64 |     
 65 |     log_info "Downloading Yazi v${YAZI_VERSION}..."
 66 |     curl -sL "$YAZI_URL" -o "$TEMP_DIR/yazi.zip"
 67 |     
 68 |     log_info "Extracting Yazi..."
 69 |     unzip -q "$TEMP_DIR/yazi.zip" -d "$TEMP_DIR"
 70 |     
 71 |     log_info "Installing Yazi to ~/.local/bin..."
 72 |     ensure_dir "$HOME/.local/bin"
 73 |     cp "$TEMP_DIR/yazi-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/yazi" "$HOME/.local/bin/"
 74 |     cp "$TEMP_DIR/yazi-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/ya" "$HOME/.local/bin/"
 75 |     chmod +x "$HOME/.local/bin/yazi" "$HOME/.local/bin/ya"
 76 |     
 77 |     rm -rf "$TEMP_DIR"
 78 |     log_success "Yazi installed"
 79 | fi
 80 | 
 81 | # =============================================================================
 82 | # Install Tmux Plugin Manager (TPM)
 83 | # =============================================================================
 84 | log_section "Installing Tmux Plugin Manager..."
 85 | 
 86 | TPM_DIR="$HOME/.tmux/plugins/tpm"
 87 | if [[ -d "$TPM_DIR" ]]; then
 88 |     log_success "TPM already installed"
 89 | else
 90 |     log_info "Cloning TPM..."
 91 |     git clone https://github.com/tmux-plugins/tpm "$TPM_DIR"
 92 |     log_success "TPM installed"
 93 | fi
 94 | 
 95 | # =============================================================================
 96 | # Copy Enhanced Configurations
 97 | # =============================================================================
 98 | log_section "Copying enhanced configurations..."
 99 | 
100 | # Backup existing configs
101 | TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)
102 | 
103 | # Copy enhanced .zshrc
104 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.zshrc.enhanced" ]]; then
105 |     if [[ -f ~/.zshrc ]]; then
106 |         cp ~/.zshrc ~/.zshrc.backup.$TIMESTAMP
107 |         log_warn "Backed up existing .zshrc"
108 |     fi
109 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.zshrc.enhanced" ~/.zshrc
110 |     log_success "Enhanced .zshrc installed"
111 | fi
112 | 
113 | # Copy enhanced tmux config
114 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/tmux/tmux.conf.enhanced" ]]; then
115 |     ensure_dir ~/.config/tmux
116 |     if [[ -f ~/.config/tmux/tmux.conf ]]; then
117 |         cp ~/.config/tmux/tmux.conf ~/.config/tmux/tmux.conf.backup.$TIMESTAMP
118 |         log_warn "Backed up existing tmux.conf"
119 |     fi
120 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/tmux/tmux.conf.enhanced" ~/.config/tmux/tmux.conf
121 |     log_success "Enhanced tmux.conf installed"
122 | fi
123 | 
124 | # Copy enhanced kitty config
125 | ensure_dir ~/.config/kitty
126 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/kitty/kitty.conf.enhanced" ]]; then
127 |     if [[ -f ~/.config/kitty/kitty.conf ]]; then
128 |         cp ~/.config/kitty/kitty.conf ~/.config/kitty/kitty.conf.backup.$TIMESTAMP
129 |         log_warn "Backed up existing kitty.conf"
130 |     fi
131 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/kitty/kitty.conf.enhanced" ~/.config/kitty/kitty.conf
132 |     log_success "Enhanced kitty.conf installed"
133 | fi
134 | 
135 | # Copy Catppuccin theme for kitty
136 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/kitty/catppuccin-mocha.conf" ]]; then
137 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/kitty/catppuccin-mocha.conf" ~/.config/kitty/
138 |     log_success "Catppuccin Mocha theme for kitty installed"
139 | fi
140 | 
141 | # Copy Catppuccin starship config (optional - user can choose)
142 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship/starship-catppuccin.toml" ]]; then
143 |     ensure_dir ~/.config/starship
144 |     # Keep both themes available
145 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship/starship-catppuccin.toml" ~/.config/starship/
146 |     log_success "Catppuccin Starship theme available at ~/.config/starship/starship-catppuccin.toml"
147 |     log_info "To use Catppuccin theme for Starship, run:"
148 |     log_info "  cp ~/.config/starship/starship-catppuccin.toml ~/.config/starship.toml"
149 | fi
150 | 
151 | # Copy yazi config if exists
152 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/yazi" ]]; then
153 |     copy_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/yazi" ~/.config/yazi
154 | fi
155 | 
156 | # Copy bat config if exists
157 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/bat" ]]; then
158 |     copy_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/bat" ~/.config/bat
159 | fi
160 | 
161 | # =============================================================================
162 | # Post-installation Setup
163 | # =============================================================================
164 | log_section "Post-installation setup..."
165 | 
166 | # Build bat cache for themes
167 | if check_command bat; then
168 |     log_info "Building bat theme cache..."
169 |     bat cache --build 2>/dev/null || true
170 |     log_success "Bat cache built"
171 | fi
172 | 
173 | # Initialize zoxide database
174 | if check_command zoxide; then
175 |     log_info "Zoxide will initialize on first use"
176 | fi
177 | 
178 | # =============================================================================
179 | # Instructions
180 | # =============================================================================
181 | log_section "Enhancement complete!"
182 | 
183 | echo ""
184 | echo -e "${CYAN}${BOLD}Next steps:${NC}"
185 | echo ""
186 | echo "1. Restart your terminal or run: source ~/.zshrc"
187 | echo ""
188 | echo "2. Install tmux plugins by pressing: Ctrl+a then I (capital i)"
189 | echo "   (This will install Catppuccin theme and session plugins)"
190 | echo ""
191 | echo "3. New aliases available:"
192 | echo "   - ls  → eza (with icons and colors)"
193 | echo "   - ll  → eza -la (detailed list)"
194 | echo "   - lt  → eza --tree (tree view)"
195 | echo "   - cat → bat (syntax highlighting)"
196 | echo "   - cd  → z (smart directory jumping)"
197 | echo "   - lg  → lazygit"
198 | echo "   - y   → yazi (file manager)"
199 | echo ""
200 | echo "4. FZF keybindings:"
201 | echo "   - Ctrl+R → Search command history"
202 | echo "   - Ctrl+T → Search files"
203 | echo "   - Alt+C  → cd to directory"
204 | echo ""
</content>
</file>
<file><path>scripts/packettracer_setup.sh</path>
<content lines="1-148">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | # =============================================================================
  3 | # packettracer_setup.sh - Cisco Packet Tracer installation (non-interactive)
  4 | # =============================================================================
  5 | 
  6 | set -e
  7 | 
  8 | # Source common utilities
  9 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
 10 | source "$SCRIPT_DIR/common.sh"
 11 | 
 12 | check_not_root
 13 | verify_backup_dir
 14 | 
 15 | # =============================================================================
 16 | # Handle Uninstall
 17 | # =============================================================================
 18 | if [[ "$1" == "--uninstall" ]]; then
 19 |     log_section "Uninstalling Cisco Packet Tracer..."
 20 |     if [[ -e /opt/pt ]]; then
 21 |         sudo rm -rf /opt/pt /usr/share/applications/cisco*-pt*.desktop
 22 |         sudo xdg-desktop-menu uninstall /usr/share/applications/cisco-pt*.desktop 2>/dev/null || true
 23 |         sudo update-mime-database /usr/share/mime 2>/dev/null || true
 24 |         sudo gtk-update-icon-cache -t --force /usr/share/icons/gnome 2>/dev/null || true
 25 |         sudo rm -f /usr/local/bin/packettracer 2>/dev/null || true
 26 |         log_success "Cisco Packet Tracer uninstalled"
 27 |     else
 28 |         log_info "Cisco Packet Tracer is not installed"
 29 |     fi
 30 |     exit 0
 31 | fi
 32 | 
 33 | # =============================================================================
 34 | # Find Installer
 35 | # =============================================================================
 36 | log_section "Installing Cisco Packet Tracer..."
 37 | 
 38 | SELECTED_INSTALLER=""
 39 | 
 40 | # First, check the backup directory for bundled installer
 41 | log_info "Checking for bundled installer..."
 42 | for installer in "$BACKUP_DIR"/Cisco*Packet*.deb "$BACKUP_DIR"/Packet*Tracer*.deb "$BACKUP_DIR"/CiscoPacketTracer*.deb; do
 43 |     if [[ -f "$installer" ]]; then
 44 |         SELECTED_INSTALLER="$installer"
 45 |         log_success "Found bundled installer: $SELECTED_INSTALLER"
 46 |         break
 47 |     fi
 48 | done
 49 | 
 50 | # If not found in backup directory, search in $HOME as fallback
 51 | if [[ -z "$SELECTED_INSTALLER" ]]; then
 52 |     log_info "Searching for installer in home directory..."
 53 |     SELECTED_INSTALLER=$(find "$HOME" -maxdepth 1 -type f \( -name "Cisco*Packet*.deb" -o -name "Packet*Tracer*.deb" \) 2>/dev/null | head -1)
 54 | fi
 55 | 
 56 | if [[ -z "$SELECTED_INSTALLER" ]]; then
 57 |     log_error "Packet Tracer installer (.deb) not found"
 58 |     echo ""
 59 |     echo "Download the installer from:"
 60 |     echo "  - https://www.netacad.com/portal/resources/packet-tracer"
 61 |     echo "  - https://skillsforall.com/resources/lab-downloads (login required)"
 62 |     echo ""
 63 |     echo "Place the .deb file in $BACKUP_DIR or your home directory and run this script again."
 64 |     exit 1
 65 | fi
 66 | 
 67 | log_success "Using installer: $SELECTED_INSTALLER"
 68 | 
 69 | # =============================================================================
 70 | # Remove Old Version
 71 | # =============================================================================
 72 | if [[ -e /opt/pt ]]; then
 73 |     log_info "Removing old version of Packet Tracer..."
 74 |     sudo rm -rf /opt/pt /usr/share/applications/cisco*-pt*.desktop 2>/dev/null || true
 75 |     sudo xdg-desktop-menu uninstall /usr/share/applications/cisco-pt*.desktop 2>/dev/null || true
 76 |     sudo update-mime-database /usr/share/mime 2>/dev/null || true
 77 |     sudo gtk-update-icon-cache -t --force /usr/share/icons/gnome 2>/dev/null || true
 78 |     sudo rm -f /usr/local/bin/packettracer 2>/dev/null || true
 79 |     log_success "Old version removed"
 80 | fi
 81 | 
 82 | # =============================================================================
 83 | # Install Dependencies
 84 | # =============================================================================
 85 | log_section "Installing dependencies..."
 86 | sudo dnf -y install binutils qt5-qt{multimedia,webengine,networkauth,websockets,webchannel,script,location,svg,speech}
 87 | log_success "Dependencies installed"
 88 | 
 89 | # =============================================================================
 90 | # Extract and Install
 91 | # =============================================================================
 92 | log_section "Extracting files..."
 93 | TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)
 94 | cd "$TEMP_DIR"
 95 | 
 96 | ar -x "$SELECTED_INSTALLER"
 97 | tar -xf control.tar.xz
 98 | tar -xf data.tar.xz
 99 | log_success "Files extracted"
100 | 
101 | log_section "Installing Packet Tracer..."
102 | sudo cp -r usr / 2>/dev/null || true
103 | sudo cp -r opt /
104 | 
105 | # Fix postinst script for Fedora (run non-interactively)
106 | sudo sed -i 's/sudo xdg-mime/sudo -u $SUDO_USER xdg-mime/' ./postinst
107 | sudo sed -i 's/sudo gtk-update-icon-cache --force/sudo gtk-update-icon-cache -t --force/' ./postinst
108 | sudo sed -i 's/CONTENTS="$CONTENTS\\n$line"/CONTENTS="$CONTENTS\
109 | $line"/' ./postinst
110 | 
111 | # Run postinst script
112 | sudo ./postinst
113 | 
114 | # Add --no-sandbox flag for running on Fedora
115 | sudo sed -i 's/packettracer/packettracer --no-sandbox args/' /usr/share/applications/cisco-pt*.desktop
116 | log_success "Packet Tracer installed"
117 | 
118 | # =============================================================================
119 | # Cleanup
120 | # =============================================================================
121 | cd - > /dev/null
122 | rm -rf "$TEMP_DIR"
123 | log_success "Temporary files cleaned up"
124 | 
125 | # =============================================================================
126 | # Restore Custom Assets
127 | # =============================================================================
128 | log_section "Restoring custom assets..."
129 | 
130 | # Restore custom icon if available
131 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/packettracer.png" ]]; then
132 |     ensure_dir ~/.local/share/icons
133 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/packettracer.png" ~/.local/share/icons/cisco-pt.png
134 |     log_success "Custom icon restored"
135 | fi
136 | 
137 | # Restore custom desktop shortcut if available
138 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/cisco-pt.desktop" ]]; then
139 |     ensure_dir ~/.local/share/applications
140 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/cisco-pt.desktop" ~/.local/share/applications/
141 |     # Replace ~ with actual home path in Icon field
142 |     sed -i "s|Icon=~/|Icon=$HOME/|g" ~/.local/share/applications/cisco-pt.desktop
143 |     log_success "Custom shortcut restored"
144 | fi
145 | 
146 | log_section "Cisco Packet Tracer installation complete!"
147 | echo ""
148 | log_info "Launch from the application menu or run 'packettracer' in terminal"
</content>
</file>
<file><path>scripts/vscode_setup.sh</path>
<content lines="1-87">
 1 | #!/bin/bash
 2 | # =============================================================================
 3 | # vscode_setup.sh - VS Code installation and configuration
 4 | # =============================================================================
 5 | 
 6 | set -e
 7 | 
 8 | # Source common utilities
 9 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
10 | source "$SCRIPT_DIR/common.sh"
11 | 
12 | check_not_root
13 | verify_backup_dir
14 | 
15 | VSCODE_USER_DIR="$HOME/.config/Code/User"
16 | VSCODE_GLOBAL_STORAGE="$HOME/.config/Code/User/globalStorage"
17 | 
18 | # =============================================================================
19 | # Install VS Code
20 | # =============================================================================
21 | log_section "Installing VS Code..."
22 | 
23 | if check_command code; then
24 |     log_success "VS Code is already installed"
25 | else
26 |     log_info "VS Code not found, installing..."
27 |     
28 |     # Import Microsoft GPG key
29 |     sudo rpm --import https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc
30 |     
31 |     # Add VSCode repository
32 |     echo -e "[code]\nname=Visual Studio Code\nbaseurl=https://packages.microsoft.com/yumrepos/vscode\nenabled=1\ngpgcheck=1\ngpgkey=https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc" | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/vscode.repo > /dev/null
33 |     
34 |     sudo dnf check-update || true
35 |     dnf_install code
36 |     log_success "VS Code installed"
37 | fi
38 | 
39 | # =============================================================================
40 | # Restore VS Code Settings
41 | # =============================================================================
42 | log_section "Restoring VS Code settings..."
43 | ensure_dir "$VSCODE_USER_DIR"
44 | 
45 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/settings.json" ]]; then
46 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/settings.json" "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/"
47 |     log_success "settings.json restored"
48 | fi
49 | 
50 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/keybindings.json" ]]; then
51 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/keybindings.json" "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/"
52 |     log_success "keybindings.json restored"
53 | fi
54 | 
55 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/snippets" ]]; then
56 |     ensure_dir "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/snippets"
57 |     cp -r "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/snippets/"* "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/snippets/"
58 |     log_success "snippets restored"
59 | fi
60 | 
61 | # =============================================================================
62 | # Install VS Code Extensions
63 | # =============================================================================
64 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/extensions.txt" ]]; then
65 |     log_section "Installing VS Code extensions..."
66 |     
67 |     while IFS= read -r extension || [[ -n "$extension" ]]; do
68 |         if [[ -n "$extension" && ! "$extension" =~ ^# ]]; then
69 |             log_info "Installing: $extension"
70 |             code --install-extension "$extension" --force 2>/dev/null || log_warn "Failed to install: $extension"
71 |         fi
72 |     done < "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/extensions.txt"
73 |     
74 |     log_success "VS Code extensions installation complete"
75 | fi
76 | 
77 | # =============================================================================
78 | # Restore Global Storage (Kilo Code, etc.)
79 | # =============================================================================
80 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code" ]]; then
81 |     log_section "Restoring Kilo Code configuration..."
82 |     ensure_dir "$VSCODE_GLOBAL_STORAGE"
83 |     cp -r "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code" "$VSCODE_GLOBAL_STORAGE/"
84 |     log_success "Kilo Code global storage restored"
85 | fi

  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | # =============================================================================
  3 | # godot_setup.sh - Godot Engine installation and configuration
  4 | # =============================================================================
  5 | 
  6 | set -e
  7 | 
  8 | # Source common utilities
  9 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
 10 | source "$SCRIPT_DIR/common.sh"
 11 | 
 12 | check_not_root
 13 | verify_backup_dir
 14 | 
 15 | # Configuration
 16 | GODOT_VERSION="${GODOT_VERSION:-4.5.1}"
 17 | GODOT_INSTALL_DIR="$HOME/.local/bin"
 18 | GODOT_CONFIG_DIR="$HOME/.config/godot"
 19 | 
 20 | # =============================================================================
 21 | # Handle Uninstall
 22 | # =============================================================================
 23 | if [[ "$1" == "--uninstall" ]]; then
 24 |     log_section "Uninstalling Godot..."
 25 |     rm -f "$GODOT_INSTALL_DIR/godot"
 26 |     rm -f "$HOME/.local/share/applications/godot.desktop"
 27 |     log_success "Godot uninstalled (config preserved in ~/.config/godot)"
 28 |     exit 0
 29 | fi
 30 | 
 31 | # =============================================================================
 32 | # Create Directories
 33 | # =============================================================================
 34 | log_section "Installing Godot Engine ${GODOT_VERSION}..."
 35 | 
 36 | ensure_dir "$GODOT_INSTALL_DIR"
 37 | ensure_dir "$HOME/.local/share/applications"
 38 | ensure_dir "$HOME/.local/share/icons"
 39 | 
 40 | # =============================================================================
 41 | # Download Godot
 42 | # =============================================================================
 43 | log_section "Downloading Godot ${GODOT_VERSION}..."
 44 | 
 45 | GODOT_ZIP="Godot_v${GODOT_VERSION}-stable_linux.x86_64.zip"
 46 | GODOT_URL="https://github.com/godotengine/godot/releases/download/${GODOT_VERSION}-stable/${GODOT_ZIP}"
 47 | 
 48 | # Check if version exists
 49 | if ! curl -sIf "$GODOT_URL" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
 50 |     log_error "Godot version ${GODOT_VERSION} not found at:"
 51 |     echo "  $GODOT_URL"
 52 |     echo ""
 53 |     echo "Available stable versions: 4.4.1, 4.3, 4.2.2, 4.1.4, 4.0.4"
 54 |     echo ""
 55 |     echo "To install a different version, set GODOT_VERSION:"
 56 |     echo "  GODOT_VERSION=4.3 bash $0"
 57 |     exit 1
 58 | fi
 59 | 
 60 | # Download to temp directory
 61 | TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d)
 62 | cd "$TEMP_DIR"
 63 | 
 64 | curl -L -o "$GODOT_ZIP" "$GODOT_URL"
 65 | log_success "Downloaded $GODOT_ZIP"
 66 | 
 67 | # =============================================================================
 68 | # Extract and Install
 69 | # =============================================================================
 70 | log_section "Extracting..."
 71 | unzip -q "$GODOT_ZIP"
 72 | GODOT_BINARY=$(find . -maxdepth 1 -name "Godot_v*" -type f | head -1)
 73 | 
 74 | if [[ -z "$GODOT_BINARY" ]]; then
 75 |     log_error "Could not find Godot binary in archive"
 76 |     rm -rf "$TEMP_DIR"
 77 |     exit 1
 78 | fi
 79 | 
 80 | chmod +x "$GODOT_BINARY"
 81 | mv "$GODOT_BINARY" "$GODOT_INSTALL_DIR/godot"
 82 | log_success "Installed to $GODOT_INSTALL_DIR/godot"
 83 | 
 84 | # Cleanup temp
 85 | cd - > /dev/null
 86 | rm -rf "$TEMP_DIR"
 87 | 
 88 | # =============================================================================
 89 | # Restore Configuration
 90 | # =============================================================================
 91 | log_section "Restoring Godot configuration..."
 92 | 
 93 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/godot" ]]; then
 94 |     ensure_dir "$GODOT_CONFIG_DIR"
 95 |     cp -r "$BACKUP_DIR/godot/"* "$GODOT_CONFIG_DIR/"
 96 |     log_success "Configuration restored to $GODOT_CONFIG_DIR"
 97 |     
 98 |     # Check VS Code integration
 99 |     if grep -q 'text_editor/external/use_external_editor = true' "$GODOT_CONFIG_DIR/"editor_settings*.tres 2>/dev/null; then
100 |         log_success "VS Code integration preserved"
101 |     fi
102 | else
103 |     log_warn "No Godot config backup found in $BACKUP_DIR/godot"
104 | fi
105 | 
106 | # =============================================================================
107 | # Desktop Integration
108 | # =============================================================================
109 | log_section "Setting up desktop integration..."
110 | 
111 | ICON_PATH="$HOME/.local/share/icons/godot.svg"
112 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/godot/godot.svg" ]]; then
113 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/godot/godot.svg" "$ICON_PATH"
114 |     log_success "Icon copied from backup"
115 | else
116 |     curl -sL -o "$ICON_PATH" "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/godotengine/godot/master/icon.svg" 2>/dev/null || true
117 |     log_success "Icon downloaded from GitHub"
118 | fi
119 | 
120 | # Create desktop entry
121 | cat > "$HOME/.local/share/applications/godot.desktop" << EOF
122 | [Desktop Entry]
123 | Name=Godot Engine
124 | Comment=Multi-platform 2D and 3D game engine
125 | Exec=$GODOT_INSTALL_DIR/godot %f
126 | Icon=$ICON_PATH
127 | Terminal=false
128 | Type=Application
129 | Categories=Development;IDE;
130 | MimeType=application/x-godot-project;
131 | Keywords=game;engine;development;
132 | EOF
133 | log_success "Desktop entry created"
134 | 
135 | # Update desktop database
136 | update-desktop-database "$HOME/.local/share/applications" 2>/dev/null || true
137 | 
138 | # =============================================================================
139 | # Verify Installation
140 | # =============================================================================
141 | echo ""
142 | if "$GODOT_INSTALL_DIR/godot" --version 2>/dev/null; then
143 |     log_success "Godot installed successfully!"
144 | else
145 |     log_warn "Godot installed but may require additional dependencies"
146 | fi
147 | 
148 | log_section "Godot setup complete!"
149 | echo ""
150 | log_info "Run Godot with: godot"
151 | log_info "Or launch from your application menu"
</content>

  1 | # Terminal Custom Setup
  2 | 
  3 | Automated terminal and development environment setup for Nobara 42 / Fedora.
  4 | 
  5 | ## Features
  6 | 
  7 | - **Shell Environment**: Zsh, Starship prompt, Atuin history, Fastfetch
  8 | - **Terminal**: Kitty GPU-accelerated terminal with Catppuccin theme
  9 | - **Fonts**: Nerd Fonts (CaskaydiaCove, FiraCode, JetBrains Mono)
 10 | - **Tmux**: Multiplexer with TPM plugins, session persistence
 11 | - **Power Tools**: zoxide, eza, bat, fzf, lazygit, yazi
 12 | - **Containers**: Podman & Podman Compose
 13 | - **VS Code**: Installation, extensions, and settings restoration
 14 | - **Qdrant**: Vector database with auto-start systemd service
 15 | - **Godot Engine**: Game engine with VS Code integration
 16 | - **Additional Apps**: Chrome, Dropbox, Discord, Obsidian, Anki
 17 | - **Cisco Packet Tracer**: Network simulation tool
 18 | - **Vietnamese Input**: ibus-bamboo for Vietnamese typing
 19 | 
 20 | ## Quick Start
 21 | 
 22 | ```bash
 23 | # Clone the repository
 24 | git clone <repo-url> terminal-custom
 25 | cd terminal-custom
 26 | 
 27 | # Full installation
 28 | ./setup.sh
 29 | 
 30 | # Or minimal (core only)
 31 | ./setup.sh --minimal
 32 | ```
 33 | 
 34 | ## Usage
 35 | 
 36 | ```bash
 37 | ./setup.sh [OPTIONS]
 38 | 
 39 | Options:
 40 |   --minimal           Core setup only (shell, dotfiles, fonts)
 41 |   --enhance           Install power tools (zoxide, eza, bat, fzf, lazygit, yazi)
 42 |   --skip-vscode       Skip VS Code installation
 43 |   --skip-qdrant       Skip Qdrant setup
 44 |   --skip-godot        Skip Godot installation
 45 |   --skip-apps         Skip additional apps (Chrome, Dropbox, Flatpaks)
 46 |   --skip-packettracer Skip Cisco Packet Tracer installation
 47 |   --vietnamese        Install Vietnamese input method (ibus-bamboo)
 48 |   --help              Show help message
 49 | 
 50 | Examples:
 51 |   ./setup.sh                              # Full installation
 52 |   ./setup.sh --minimal                    # Core setup only
 53 |   ./setup.sh --enhance                    # Add power tools to existing setup
 54 |   ./setup.sh --skip-godot --skip-apps     # Skip Godot and apps
 55 | ```
 56 | 
 57 | ## Project Structure
 58 | 
 59 | ```
 60 | .
 61 | ├── setup.sh                    # Master orchestrator script
 62 | ├── assets/                     # Configuration data and assets
 63 | │   ├── .zshrc, .bashrc, .gitconfig
 64 | │   ├── .config/                # App configs (starship, atuin, fastfetch, kitty)
 65 | │   ├── fonts/                  # Nerd Fonts collection
 66 | │   ├── godot/                  # Godot editor settings
 67 | │   ├── vscode/                 # VS Code settings and extensions
 68 | │   ├── images/                 # Custom assets (fastfetch logo)
 69 | │   └── CiscoPacketTracer*.deb  # Packet Tracer installer (optional)
 70 | └── scripts/
 71 |     ├── common.sh               # Shared utilities and logging
 72 |     ├── core_setup.sh           # System updates, packages, shell, fonts, dotfiles
 73 |     ├── enhance_terminal.sh     # Power tools and enhanced configs
 74 |     ├── vscode_setup.sh         # VS Code installation and configuration
 75 |     ├── qdrant_setup.sh         # Qdrant vector database with Podman
 76 |     ├── godot_setup.sh          # Godot Engine installation
 77 |     ├── apps_setup.sh           # Chrome, Dropbox, Flatpak apps
 78 |     ├── packettracer_setup.sh   # Cisco Packet Tracer installation
 79 |     └── input_setup.sh          # Vietnamese input method (ibus-bamboo)
 80 | ```
 81 | 
 82 | ## What Gets Installed
 83 | 
 84 | ### Core Setup (`core_setup.sh`)
 85 | - System update (dnf)
 86 | - Packages: zsh, git, curl, wget, util-linux-user, fastfetch, kitty, podman, podman-compose, tmux
 87 | - Starship prompt, Atuin shell history
 88 | - Zsh plugins: autosuggestions, syntax-highlighting, autocomplete
 89 | - Dotfiles: .zshrc, .bashrc, .gitconfig
 90 | - Config directories: starship, atuin, fastfetch, kitty, tmux
 91 | - Fonts installed to ~/.local/share/fonts
 92 | - Default shell changed to Zsh
 93 | 
 94 | ### Terminal Enhancement (`enhance_terminal.sh`)
 95 | - **Power Tools**:
 96 |   - `zoxide` - Smart cd replacement (learns your directories)
 97 |   - `eza` - Modern ls with icons, colors, and git status
 98 |   - `bat` - Cat with syntax highlighting
 99 |   - `fzf` - Fuzzy finder with Catppuccin theme
100 |   - `ripgrep` - Fast grep alternative
101 |   - `fd-find` - Fast find alternative
102 |   - `lazygit` - Terminal UI for git
103 |   - `yazi` - Terminal file manager with image preview
104 | - **Tmux Plugins** (via TPM):
105 |   - Catppuccin theme
106 |   - tmux-resurrect (save/restore sessions)
107 |   - tmux-continuum (auto-save sessions)
108 |   - tmux-yank (system clipboard)
109 | - **Enhanced Configs**:
110 |   - `.zshrc.enhanced` with aliases and tool integrations
111 |   - `kitty.conf.enhanced` with CaskaydiaCove Nerd Font & Catppuccin
112 |   - `tmux.conf.enhanced` with TPM and Catppuccin theme
113 |   - `starship-catppuccin.toml` optional Catppuccin starship theme
114 | 
115 | **New Aliases After Enhancement:**
116 | ```bash
117 | ls  → eza --icons              # List with icons
118 | ll  → eza -la --icons --git    # Detailed list with git status
119 | lt  → eza --tree               # Tree view
120 | cat → bat                       # Syntax highlighted cat
121 | lg  → lazygit                   # Git TUI
122 | y   → yazi                      # File manager (cd on exit)
123 | z   → zoxide                    # Smart directory jumping
124 | ```
125 | 
126 | ### VS Code Setup (`vscode_setup.sh`)
127 | - VS Code installation via Microsoft repo
128 | - Settings and keybindings restoration
129 | - Extensions installation from extensions.txt
130 | - Kilo Code global storage restoration
131 | 
132 | ### Qdrant Setup (`qdrant_setup.sh`)
133 | - Podman container setup
134 | - Systemd user service (auto-start on boot)
135 | - Available at http://localhost:6333
136 | 
137 | ### Godot Setup (`godot_setup.sh`)
138 | - Downloads Godot (default: 4.4.1, configurable via `GODOT_VERSION` env var)
139 | - Installs to ~/.local/bin/godot
140 | - Restores editor settings with VS Code integration
141 | - Creates desktop entry
142 | 
143 | ### Apps Setup (`apps_setup.sh`)
144 | - Google Chrome (DNF)
145 | - Dropbox (DNF)
146 | - Discord, Obsidian, Anki (Flatpak)
147 | 
148 | ### Packet Tracer Setup (`packettracer_setup.sh`)
149 | - Converts Ubuntu .deb package for Fedora
150 | - Installs Qt5 dependencies
151 | - Non-interactive installation
152 | 
153 | ### Vietnamese Input Setup (`input_setup.sh`)
154 | - Installs ibus and ibus-bamboo
155 | - Configures IBus environment variables
156 | - Supports Telex typing method (default)
157 | 
158 | ## Individual Script Usage
159 | 
160 | You can run individual scripts directly:
161 | 
162 | ```bash
163 | # Run only terminal enhancement
164 | bash scripts/enhance_terminal.sh
165 | 
166 | # Run only VS Code setup
167 | bash scripts/vscode_setup.sh
168 | 
169 | # Run only Qdrant setup
170 | bash scripts/qdrant_setup.sh
171 | 
172 | # Install Godot with specific version
173 | GODOT_VERSION=4.3 bash scripts/godot_setup.sh
174 | 
175 | # Uninstall Godot
176 | bash scripts/godot_setup.sh --uninstall
177 | 
178 | # Uninstall Packet Tracer
179 | bash scripts/packettracer_setup.sh --uninstall
180 | 
181 | # Install Vietnamese input
182 | bash scripts/input_setup.sh
183 | ```
184 | 
185 | ## Post-Enhancement Setup
186 | 
187 | After running `./setup.sh --enhance`, complete these steps:
188 | 
189 | 1. **Restart terminal** or run `source ~/.zshrc`
190 | 
191 | 2. **Install tmux plugins**: Open tmux and press `Ctrl+a` then `I` (capital i)
192 | 
193 | 3. **Optional - Use Catppuccin Starship theme**:
194 |    ```bash
195 |    cp ~/.config/starship/starship-catppuccin.toml ~/.config/starship.toml
196 |    ```
197 | 
198 | 4. **Zoxide**: Just start using `z` command - it learns your directories automatically
199 | 
200 | 5. **FZF keybindings**:
201 |    - `Ctrl+R` - Search command history
202 |    - `Ctrl+T` - Search files
203 |    - `Alt+C` - cd to directory
204 | 
205 | ## Requirements
206 | 
207 | - Nobara 42 or Fedora-based distribution
208 | - User with sudo access
209 | - Internet connection
210 | 
211 | ## Legacy Scripts
212 | 
213 | Previous installation scripts are preserved in `terminal_backup/` for reference:
214 | - `install.sh` - Original all-in-one script
215 | - `install_apps.sh` - Original apps installer
216 | - `install_godot.sh` - Original Godot installer
217 | - `install_packettracer.sh` - Original Packet Tracer installer
218 | 
219 | ## License
220 | 
221 | Personal configuration backup - use at your own discretion.
